nodes.text: Is that any way to greet a fellow Drat Catcher?
So, why are you hanging out here now? Did you get tired of hunting Drats and wanted to add some giant bugs to your diet?
What were you growling about? Nothing around here to worry about - you've already killed the Proach.
<shakes head>
So is that a yes or a no or something else? Sorry, I didn't take Wolfish as a foreign language elective.
By the way, how did you get in here? These gates don't open themselves. For someone with paws instead of hands, you seem very handy at getting around down here.
Okay, Miss Dark, Hairy, and Silent, keep your secrets.
You don't mind if I look around a bit, do you? I still haven't figured out what you were growling about.
Fine, just sit there. I'll check things out.
What's the matter? You aren't hurt, are you?
You certainly don't look wounded. I'll assume that blood on your fur is from something else...
You do seem to be looking over at the wooden door when you whine. Is there something about the wooden door that bothers you? Or maybe what's behind that door?
Should I check it out?
<whine>
Okay, I'll be very, very careful. I'll try not to disturb the big, bad door too much.
From the way you keep looking over at the locked door, I gather you really don't like what's on the other side. Frankly, I don't blame you. It's pretty scary.
Still, I think I can handle it.
That's a mighty big bug you killed there. Gregor would be so pleased to have some Proach parts to add to his pizza. You don't mind if I share it with him, do you?
<grrrrrr>
Right. You keep your Proach. I'll have to hunt for my own.
Hey, take care. Don't let the Proaches pinch or Drats get you down.
<wags tail>
Ah, happy to see me go, eh? I'll keep that in mind the next time we meet.
Okay, I'm okay. I'm not bug lunch yet.
I take it you knew that there was a gigantic Proach in that next room?
<whine>
Well, thanks for the warning, even if I didn't quite understand what you were saying.
Well, the good news is that the Giant Proach is locked away here in the Wine Cellar where it won't hurt anyone...
Unless, of course, they are stupid... or greedy... enough to take it on.
<whine>
Yeah, I know.
Well, goodnight. Don't let the bedbugs bite - or the ginormous Proaches, either.
<wags tail>
You know, for a Wolf, you make a good watchdog.
You do a great job at protecting the school from Drats and Proaches.
